intro: Vachellia janzenii, commonly known as the Janzen's acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to the dry forests of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features bipinnate leaves and produces yellow or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. The seeds are enclosed in pods and are often dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in local ecosystems.
